channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Man Accused of Setting Subway Rider on Fire Is Charged With Arson
item.description: The victim was sleeping on a train at Penn Station in Manhattan around 3 a.m. Monday when an 18-year-old man set him on fire, the police said.

item.title: Rich New Yorkers Threaten to Leave. Then They Find Out How Hard That Is.
item.description: Tax accountants and lawyers detail the arduous process wealthy New Yorkers would have to face to avoid paying New York State and city taxes.

item.title: Survivors of the Deadly Hong Kong Fire Are in Limbo
item.description: Hong Kong, with some of the world’s highest housing costs and inequality, must now figure out how to help thousands of residents who lost friends, fam...

item.title: Frank Gehry, Titan of Architecture, Is Dead at 96
item.description: He burst onto the scene with an attention-getting renovation of his Southern California home before going on to design some of the world’s most recogn...

item.title: Trump’s Security Strategy Focuses on Profit, Not Spreading Democracy
item.description: President Trump’s new National Security Strategy describes a country that is focused on doing business and reducing migration while avoiding passing j...

item.title: China’s Mad at Japan, and Pop Stars Are Paying for It
item.description: Beijing is curbing Japanese movies, music and art as it seeks to punish Tokyo for its support of Taiwan.

item.title: Survivors of the Deadly Hong Kong Fire Are in Limbo
item.description: Hong Kong, with some of the world’s highest housing costs and inequality, must now figure out how to help thousands of residents who lost friends, fam...

item.title: China’s Mad at Japan, and Pop Stars Are Paying for It
item.description: Beijing is curbing Japanese movies, music and art as it seeks to punish Tokyo for its support of Taiwan.

item.title: The rise of AI reasoning models comes with a big energy tradeoff
item.description: AI reasoning models used 30 times more power on average to respond to 1,000 written prompts than alternatives without it, a new study finds.

item.title: Musk’s SpaceX discusses record valuation, IPO as soon as 2026
item.description: The transaction would value Elon Musk’s startup at a valuation higher than OpenAI’s record-setting $500 billion, people familiar with the matter said.

item.title: U.S. consumers are so financially strained they put more than $1 billion on buy-now, pay later services during Black Friday and Cyber Monday
item.description: BNPL made up for more than 7.2% of total online sales on Cyber Monday.

item.title: Hollywood writers say Warner takeover ‘must be blocked’
item.description: “The world’s largest streaming company swallowing one of its biggest competitors is what antitrust laws were designed to prevent,” the WGA said.

item.title: It’s ‘kind of jarring’: AI labs like Meta, Deepseek, and Xai earned some of the worst grades possible on an existential safety index
item.description: Anthropic, OpenAI, and Google DeepMind took the top three spots with an overall grade of C+ or C.

item.title: Gianni Infantino Awards Trump a FIFA Peace Prize and Announces World Cup Draw
item.description: Gianni Infantino, head of soccer’s governing body, has been ingratiating himself with the president to help ensure a successful 2026 World Cup.

item.title: Man Who Swallowed Stolen Fabergé Egg Passes It Naturally, Police Say
item.description: The man ingested the egg locket at a jewelry store in New Zealand last week, according to the authorities.
